ja73:1.1: An ascetic saved a prince, a parrot, a rat, and a snake from a flood. Since the animals were in greater need, he fed them first. While the animals were all grateful, the proud prince conceived a hatred, which he nursed until he ascended the throne and sought revenge for the imagined slight.
ja73:1.3: I translate literally, but the verse seems to need the verb “rescue” supplied by the commentary (uttāretvā).
